    • Method Detail

      • isEnabled

        public static boolean isEnabled()
        Returns:
        true if the bluetooth of the device is currently activated, false otherwise

      • enable

        public static void enable(android.app.Activity context,
                          boolean ask)
        Activates the bluetooth of the device
        Parameters:
        context - application context used to launch the intent
        ask - if true, the user will be asked permission. Otherwise, the bluetooth will be activated without him being notified

      • disable

        public static void disable()
        Disables the bluetooth of the device

      • getName

        public static java.lang.String getName()
        Returns:
        the name the device. This is the name other devices will see if your device is discoverable

      • setName

        public static void setName(java.lang.String name)
        modifies the name of the device. This is the name other devices will see if your device is discoverable
        Parameters:
        name - the new name of th device

      • getAddress

        public static java.lang.String getAddress()
        Returns:
        the address of the device.

      • enableDiscoverability

        public static void enableDiscoverability(android.app.Activity context,
                                         int time)
        allow other device to see this device for the given duration.
        Parameters:
        time - duration, in seconds, of the device discoverability.

      • startDiscovery

        public static void startDiscovery(android.content.Context context,
                                  long time,
                                  DeviceDiscoveryListener listener)
        Starts discovering the surrounding devices. If you already started a discovering, this function will do nothing.
        When a device is discovered, the listener's DeviceDiscoveryListener.deviceDiscovered(BluetoothDevice) function is called with the discovered device as the parameter.
        When the timeout period has been reached, the discovery is cancelled and the listener's DeviceDiscoveryListener.discoveryFinished() function is called.
        You can also stop the discovery by calling thecancelDiscovery(Context) method. Be aware that doing so, the listener's DeviceDiscoveryListener.discoveryFinished() method will not be called.
        Parameters:
        context -
        time - timeout, in milliseconds. the dicovery is cancelled when thi time has passed
        listener - will be called when a new device is discovered, or when the timeout is reached

      • cancelDiscovery

        public static void cancelDiscovery(android.content.Context context)
        Cancels the device discovery. Do not forget to call this function when you don't need the discovery to be running, because device discovering costs a lot of energy
        Parameters:
        context -

      • chooseDevice

        public static void chooseDevice(android.app.Activity context,
                                @Nullable
                                java.lang.String title,
                                BasicListener<android.bluetooth.BluetoothDevice> listener,
                                int requestTag)
        This function activates bluetooth (requesting user permission), looks for surrounding devices, show all of them in a dialog window and asks the user to pick one. When the user has picked one or cancelled the dialog, the listener is called with the selected device, or null.
        Parameters:
        context -
        title - dialog box title
        listener - will be called when the user has made his choice.
        requestTag - tag that will be used when calling the listener

      • cleanUp

        public void cleanUp(android.app.Activity context)
        this method must be called on application's onDestroy to ensure that the device is not trying to discover other devices because this operation takes lots of energy.
